subject: AI & Agents
title: Smart Farms: AI Feeds the World
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Smart Farms: AI Feeds the World.

hook.text: An AI system spots a single diseased plant among 100,000 and treats only that one. No waste.

buildup.text: Precision agriculture uses AI, drones, and sensors to optimize every aspect of farming.

discovery.text: AI predicts crop yields, detects pests early, and recommends exact water and fertilizer amounts.

twist.text: Smallholder farmers in developing countries often lack the infrastructure to use these tools.

climax.text: Feeding 10 billion people by 2050 may require AI-driven farming to become universally accessible.

punchline.text: To feed the future, we must farm smarter. AI is the tractor of this century.

quiz.question: How does AI improve precision agriculture?
options: It detects individual plant issues and optimizes resource use precisely
It replaces all farm workers with robots
It only works for large corporate farms
